metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15049 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in http/ContentLengthInterpreter.cc in Squid before4.12 and 5.x before 5.0.3. A Request Smuggling and Poisoning attack cansucceed against the HTTP cache. The client sends an HTTP request with aContent-Length header containing "+\ "-" or an uncommon shell whitespacecharacter prefix to the length field-value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
squid-cgi - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
squid-common - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
squid-purge - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
squid3 - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
squidclient - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: squid3 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9').
